author: Akin Oyedele
title: WeWork chairman posts photos of lavish pasta tasting day after layoffs - Business Insider
description: The embattled startup confirmed Thursday that it was laying off 2,400 employees, or about 20% of its global workforce.
content:
WeWork Chairman Marcelo Claure shared his pasta tasting at a high-end Italian restaurant on social media a day after the embattled startup began massive layoffs.

author: Matthew DeBord
title: The RAM 1500 pickup truck is Business Insider's 2019 Car of the Year - Business Insider
description: It bested some serious competition, including the Lamborghini Urus, Nissan Leaf SL Plus, Cadillac XT4, Mercedes A220, and Porsche Cayenne.
content:

It joins an illustrious lineup of past winners: the Corvette Stingray in 2014, the Volvo XC90 in 2015, the Acura NSX in 2016, the Porsche Panamera in 2017, and the Kia Stinger in 2018.

title: Hear Smerconish's pick for Time's 2019 Person of the Year - CNN
description: CNN's Michael Smerconish takes a look at Time magazine's Person of the Year over the last several decades and gives his input on who he thinks has earned the title for 2019.

author: Tim Mullaney
title: Charles Schwab just broke one of Warren Buffett's biggest rules about acquisitions - CNBC
description: In making an all-stock deal for TD Ameritrade, Charles Schwab just broke one of Berkshire Hathaway chairman and CEO Warren Buffett's biggest rules about acquisitions: Never give your own shares away.
content:
With two huge mergers being the talk of Wall Street, which one would Warren Buffett do?
On Monday Charles Schwab announced a $26 billion all-stock deal for TD Ameritrade. LVMH, meanwhile, approved on Sunday a $16 billion all-cash deal for Tiffany's.
Most in… [+12080 chars]

title: Charles Schwab To Buy TD Ameritrade, Creating Brokerage Behemoth - NPR
description: Changes are rippling through the financial services market as trade fees drop to zero. The merger will likely attract antitrust scrutiny, as the combined firms will hold $5 trillion in client assets.
content:
Brokerage giant Charles Schwab said Monday it will acquire competitor TD Ameritrade in an all-stock transaction valued at $26 billion. A Schwab office in Oakland, Calif., is seen here.
Paul Sakuma/AP
Two of the country's largest brokerage firms will become … [+2442 chars]

author: Yun Li
title: Bitcoin sinks to lowest level since May, falling $3,000 in a month as China accelerates crackdown - CNBC
description: Bitcoin slid after China pledged to continue to target cryptocurrency exchanges and asked investors to be wary of digital coins.
content:
What a tough month it has been for bitcoin.
